Here's an example of a Textual Modal Screen help template in Python using Tkinter library:

```python
import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import messagebox

class ModalScreen:
    def __init__(self, root):
        self.root = root
        self.title = "Modal Screen Help"
        self.description = ""
        self.button_text = ""

        # Create the main window
        self.main_frame = tk.Frame(root)
        self.main_frame.pack()

        # Create a help button
        self.help_button = tk.Button(self.main_frame, text="Help", command=self.display_help)
        self.help_button.pack(side=tk.LEFT)

        # Create a label for displaying the description and button text
        self.description_label = tk.Label(self.main_frame, text="", wraplength=400, font=("Arial", 12))
        self.description_label.pack()

    def display_help(self):
        # Get the help message from the user (in this case, a placeholder message)
        self.help_message = "This is a sample modal screen. You can open it by clicking on the 'Help' button."

        # Display the help message in the window
        messagebox.showinfo(self.title, self.help_message)

root = tk.Tk()
modal_screen = ModalScreen(root)
root.mainloop()
```

In this code:

* We create a `ModalScreen` class that has methods to display help messages.
* The `display_help` method gets the user's input (in this case, a placeholder message) and displays it in a Tkinter message box using `messagebox.showinfo`.
* We use a `Label` widget to display the description and button text.

You can customize this code as per your requirements. For example, you can add more options for displaying help messages or modify the appearance of the window.
